Handwritten notes: Write out important information or summaries of documents by hand to aid in retention and organization.
Collaborate with others: Work with peers or colleagues to share knowledge, exchange ideas, and complete tasks collaboratively.
Audio or video recordings: Record meetings, lectures, or explanations to refer back to later.
Physical tools and equipment: Utilize non-digital tools, such as graph paper, protractors, or physical models, to complete mathematical or scientific tasks.
Create a backup plan: Regularly back up important documents and files to a physical storage device, such as an external hard drive, for use in case of a computer crash.
